newsitem.title: USA: Assets of U.S. money market funds fell in week.
newsitem.headline: Assets of U.S. money market funds fell in week.

text.p: Total money market mutual fund assets in the week ended April 23 fell to $964.26 billion from a revised $971.63 billion the prior week, an industry trade group said Thursday.
The Investment Company Institute said assets of the nation's 665 retail money market mutual funds fell $8.93 billion to $646.24 billion in the week.

Of the retail funds, assets of the 402 taxable money market funds fell $5.56 billion to $530.49 billion, while assets of the 263 tax-exempt funds fell $3.37 billion to $115.75 billion, the group said.

ICI said assets of the 323 institutional money market funds rose $1.57 billion to $318.02 billion. Of these, assets of the 260 taxable money market funds increased $2.32 billion to $287.42 billion, while assets of the 63 tax-exempt funds fell $751.1 million to $30.60 billion, it said.
ICI revised last week's money market mutual fund assets to $971.63 billion from $971.96 billion.
